0707071-d-07-07-07-MMA.Maintenance Railroad Name: Montreal, Maine and Atlantic Railway, Ltd.
0707071-d-07-07-07-MMA.Narrative:
MAIN TRACK / METHOD OF OPERATION OCS (CLEARANCE).
NO. 101 OPERATING SOUTH WITH 64-2 6328 DERAILED SIX LOADS AT MILE 117.7.  THE DERAILED CARS WHERE LOCATED AS THE LAST SIX CARS IN THE TRAIN.  INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT GMRC 7095 LOAD PAPER DERAILED L3-L4 TRAILING TRUCK WHICH CLIMBED WEST (OUTSIDE)RAIL OF LEFT-HAND CURVE.  EXAMINATION OF SIDE-BEARINGS DISCLOSED NO SIDE-BEARING CLEARANCE ON LEFT-SIDE A END.  SECONDARY CAUSE WAS AN INADEQUATE BALLAST SHOULDER ON THE WEST SIDE OF CURVE TOGETHER WITH TIE PLACEMENT WHICH ALLOWED THE A-END TRUCK TO SHOVE THE CURVE OUT OF ALIGNMENT.  ONE LOAD OVERTURNED (CBRY 1808 LUMBER) AND FIVE CARS DERAILED AND UPRIGHT.

0707211-d-07-21-07-MMA.Contributing Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
0707211-d-07-21-07-MMA.Accident Cause: Train outside yard limits in non block territory, excessive speed
0707211-d-07-21-07-MMA.Narrative: NO 101 OPERATING SOUTH IN 10 MPH SPEED RESTRICTION BETWEEN MILE 114 AND MILE 113 WHEN L1 WHEEL ON NBSR 6106 LOAD LOGS DERAILED ON HIGH SIDE OF CURVE TOWARD EAST SIDE OF TRACK.  L1 WHEEL WAS TRAILING WHEEL ON NORTH END OF CAR (EAST SIDE).  CAR WAS HAULED DERAILED FOR APPROXIMATELY 6 MILES TO THE NORTH END OF MILLINOCKET YARD WHERE DERAILED WHEEL ENCOUNTERED THE TRAILING POINT SWITCH AT NORTH END OFYARD.  DERAILED WHEEL OF NBSR 6106 STRUCK FROG CAUSING FURTHER DERAILMENT OF 12 ADDITIONAL LOADS (ALL LOGS).  EXAMINATION OF LOCOMOTIVE DOWNLOAD REVEALED THAT CREW OF NO 101 WAS EXCEEDING THE 10MPH SPEED RESTRICTION BETWEEN MILE 114 AND MILE 113 BY APPROXIMATELY 3 TO 9 MPH FOR ENTIRE LENGTH OF SPEED RESTRICTION.  NBSR 6106 DERAILED AT MILE 113.30 WHEN TRAIN MOVING APPROXIMATELY 3 TO 5 MPH ABOVE TEMPORARY SPEED RESTRICTION.  DERAILMENT WAS CAUSED BY EXCESSIVE SPEED COMBINED WITH HARMONIC ROCK FORCES.

I1307-d-07-25-07-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Other mechanical and electrical failures, (LOCOMOTIVE) (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I1307-d-07-25-07-PATH.Accident Cause: Other mechanical and electrical failures, (LOCOMOTIVE) (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I1307-d-07-25-07-PATH.Narrative:
ON JULY 25, A CREW CONSISTING OF 1 ENGINEER, MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT OPERATOR AND A TRACKMAN WERE TRAVELING TOWARD THE HACK BRIDGE IN UTV-1 WHEN THEY STARTED TO EXPERIENCE MECHANICAL PROBLEMS.  THE EIC ADVISED THE TRAINMASTER AT 1:56AM THAT AS A RESULT OF THE MECHANICAL PROBLEMS THEY WERE TERMINATING WORK AND RETURNING TO THE CONSOLIDATED MAINTENANCE SHOP.  THE UTV STALLED OUT ON THE APPROACH TO THEHACK BRIDGE AT 2:22AM AND CAUGHT FIRE AT 2:25AM.  POWER WAS REMOVED FROM TRACKS G-6 AND H-6.  ALL THREE CREW MEMBERS CLEARED THE UTV SAFELY AND ATTEMPTED TO EXTINGUISH THE FIRE.  THE FIRE FULLY ENGULFED UTV-1 AND THE JERSEY CITY FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS ADVISED AND RESPONDED BY 2:48 AND IMMEDIATELY REQUESTED ADDITIONAL FIRE EQUIPMENT.  THE UTV FIRE OCCURRED ON AN ELEVATED TRACK OVER THE CSX INTERMODALTERMINAL FACILITY.  THE MIXTURE OF FIRE FIGHTING FOAM AND DIESEL/OIL DRAINED ONTO THE CSX ROADWAY AND TEMPORARILY HALTED THEIR TRUCKING OPERATION.  THE PORT AUTHORITY ENVIRONMENTAL CONTRACTOR (ATLANTIC RESPONSE) ARRIVED AT 7:00PM TO INSPECT THE AREA AND PREPARE FOR A WASHDOWN AND COLLECTION OPERATION.  THE WAY & STRUCTURES DIVISION INSTALLED 6 HORIZONTAL DRAIN PIPES UNDER THE BRIDGE AND PLACED A 200 GALON  PLASTIC CONTAINER WITH OIL ABSORBENT PADS TO TEMPORARILY COLLECT ANY RESIDUAL DIESEL/OIL.THEY ALSO VACUUMED APPROXIMATELY 150 BALLAST STONES FROM THE AREA.

THE CAUSE OF THE FIRE HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED AS AN ELECTRICAL/MECHANICAL MALFUNCTION ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PARTICULAR UTV-1 MODEL.  T

561257-d-07-04-07-IC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING DUTIES, CREW PULLED A 53 CAR CUT OF THE NORTH END TRACK MA21 AND THEN KICKED CAR GATX 40203, A LOADED TANK OF CREOSOTE, TOWARDS MA14.  THE BRAKEMAN THEN SAW THAT CAR DTI9742, EMPTY GONDOLA, WAS OUT FOUL ON TRACK MA13.  THE BRAKEMAN PUSHED THE ELECTRIC SWITCH BUTTON TO TRYTO LINE GATX 40203 INTO MA13 TO AVOID THE CORNERING BUT THE SWITCH DIDN'T THROW QUICK ENOUGH.  NOTHING DERAILED HOWEVER GATX 40203 AND DTI 9742 BOTH SUSTAINED DAMAGE.  INSPECTION OF THE SWITCH BUTTONFOUND THAT THE BUTTON DID NOT ACTUATED THE SWITCH ALL THE TIME.  ELECTRICIAN WAS CALLED  OUT TO INSPECT THE SWITCH BUTTON

561786-d-07-04-07-IC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING OPERATIONS, R91191-04 KICKED 6 CARS INTO CA16, TWO OF THE SIX CARS CLEARED WHEN THE LEAD CAR, SHPX 205822 COUPLED TO A CUT OF CARS ON CA15 AND ROLLED BACK INTO THE CARS ON CA16 STRIKING TILX 110276, TILX 110265, TILX 110260 & TILX 110258. 563398-d-07-25-07-IC.Narrative: YARD JOB, R97171-24 WAS SWITCHING CARS IN THE DESTREHAN YARD WHEN THE CREW KICKED  CAR NATX 30506 TOTRACK 2.  THE CONDUCTOR STATED THAT TRACK 2 WAS IN THE CLEAR AND HE WAS READY FOR THE 6 CAR CUT FORTRACK3.  WHEN THE 6 CAR CUT WAS KICKED, NATX 30505 STRUCK CAR NATX 30506 THAT WAS LEFT OUT TO FOULON TRACK 2 SIDE SWIPING IT AND DAMAGING ALL 7 CARS.  NO CARS WERE DERAILED.  THREE OF THE CARS WERERESIDUE CARS LAST CONTAINING METHANOL- NO LEAKS OR EXPOSURES  WERE REPORTED. THE CREW WAS DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTED, ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.

563186-d-07-22-07-IC.Narrative: JOB R96071-22 WAS SHOVING TRACK 14 FROM THE NORTH END TO MAKE ROOM WHEN PTTX 93115 WAS SHOVED OUT THE SOUTH END FOULING THE SOUTH LEAD.  THE EMPTY FLAT CAR WAS STRUCK BY MBLX 28030 ( EMPTY TANK) THATWAS KICKED BY R96171'S CREW.  INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT BRAKEMAN WAS ON THE SOUTH END PROTECTING THESHOVE.  BRAKEMAN INSTRUCTED ENGINEER TO SHOVE 6 CAR LENGTHS AND ENGINEER COULD NOT HEAR BRAKEMAN'S RADIO, SO THE CONDUCTOR RELAYED THE CAR LENGTHS LEFT TO SHOVE.  WHEN BRAKEMAN STATED 1 CAR LENGTH TOGO THE CONDUCTOR WAITED FOR 1/2 CAR AND THEN TOLD ENGINEER TO STOP.  THE SLACK RAN OUT FOULING THE SOUTH END LEAD.  JOB R96171-22 HAD ALREADY LET 2 EMPTY TANKS GO TOWARD TRACK 15 SIDE SWIPING PTTX 93115 EMPTY FLAT.  THE EMPTY TANK CAR INVOLVED WAS MBLX 28030..  THE CREW WAS TESTED AND FORMAL INVESTIGATION SCHEDULED.  R96171 WAS SWITCHING A 28 CAR CUT AND KICKED A 28 CAR CUT AND KICKED THE 28TH AND27TH CARS TOWARDS TRACK 15.  MBLX 25030 STRUCK PTTX 931115 THAT WAS SHOVED OUT OF TRACK 14 BY R96071 AND IN THE FOUL.  NO CARS WERE DERAILED IN THE IMPACT.

562093-d-07-11-07-IC.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
562093-d-07-11-07-IC.Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
562093-d-07-11-07-IC.Narrative: REMOTE JOB, RCL 95271-11, WAS SWITCHING FROM THE NORTH LEAD.  THREE HANDBRAKES HAD BEEN APPLIED TO THE SOUTH 3 CARS IN TRACK JX15.  THESE 3 CARS HAD WABCO STYLE BRAKE SYSTEMS.  WHEN 3 SETS OF 4 LOADEDCARS WERE SWITCHED INTO JX 15 FROM THE NORTH END, THE CARS ROLLED ON THE SOUTH END DERAILING UTLX 12290 AND UTLX 13854.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CARS ROLLED OUT DUE TO INSUFFICIENT HANDBRAKES BEING SET, HOWEVER, THE CREW SET THE REQUIRED HANDBRAKES PER PROCEDURES AND WERE UNAWARE THAT DUE TO THE WABCO STYLE BRAKES MORE WOULD NEED TO BE SET TO HOLD THE CARS.  CREW WAS NOT HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DERAILMENT.

202303-d-07-07-07-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 484 ARRIVED EAST HASTINGS ON #2 MTWITH 20 CARS TO SET OUT ON 2 TRACK. CONDUCTOR MADE CUT 45 CARS DEEP, TOOK OFF DERAIL ON 2 TRACK, HAND LINED SWITCH OFF #2 MT REVERSE POSITION, WALKED WEST & ASCERTAINED 1-2 TRACK SWITCH WAS LINED FOR THEIR MOVEMENT TOWARD 2 TRACK.  CONDUCTOR POSITIONED SELF ABOUT 5 CAR LENGTHS WEST OF THE 1-2 TRACK SWITCH TO PROTECT SHOVE. WESTWARD SHOVE MOVEMENT WAS MADE FROM #2 MT TO 2 TRACK (JOINTED RAIL) AT 8.2 MPH. WHEN THE 7TH CAR, EEC 61205, MADE FACING POINT MOVEMENT OVER THE SWITCH, IT DERAILED, ACCOUNT A 3 INCH PIECE BROKE OFF TOP OF POINT & BECAME LODGED BETWEEN THE STOCK RAIL & SWITCH POINT. A GAP WAS CREATED & 7TH CAR OVER THE SWITCH PICKED THE POINT, CLIMBED THE RAIL & BEGAN THE DERAILMENT SEQUENCE WHICH INVOLVED A TOTAL OF 4 CARS. CONDUCTOR HEARD AN UNUSUAL NOISE, LOOKED BACK AT THE 1 - 2 TRACK SWITCH AND SAW THE DERAILED EQUIPMENT. CONDUCTOR IMMEDIATELY INSTRUCTED ENGINEER TO STOP MOVEMENT.

202305-d-07-08-07-SOO.Narrative: EASTBOUND TRAIN 738-07 DERAILED 6 CARS WHILE YARDING AT BRC CLEARING - TRACK #14. CARS 36-41 WERE DERAILED AS FOLLOWS - GCCX 112233, UTLX 667614, UTLX 666454, GATX 55008, UTLX 666514, UTLX 667448. THETRAIN WAS IN THE PROCESS OF STOPPING ON STRAIGHT RAIL AT THE WEST END OF TRACK #14. REVIEW OF DOWNLOAD INDICATES SPEED TO BE 8.8 MPH - THROTTLE MODULATION BETWEEN NOTCH 1 & 2. NO EXCEPTION WAS TAKENWITH CREW OR TRAIN HANDLING.  CAUSE OF DERAILMENT DETERMINED TO BE WIDE TRACK GAUGE DUE TO POOR TIECONDITION & RAIL EXPANSION DUE TO 92F DEGREE AMBIANT TEMPERATURE. BRC ADVISES TRACK DAMAGE AT $1,650.00.  BRC, THE OTHER RAILROAD INVOLVED HAS BEEN NOTIFIED BUT HAS NOT FILED FORM 6180.54 TO DATE.

202419-d-07-13-07-SOO.Narrative: 199-13 WAS AT SHOREHAM, AND COMPLETED THEIR PICKUP OF 18 CARS ON THE REAR OF TRAIN. PICKUP WAS OFF PARK 2 TRACK. TRAIN WAS PULLING WEST OUT OF THE PARK YARD, WHEN THE CONDUCTOR REPORTED THE REAR CAR,DTTX 658214 WAS DERAILED. REAR SET OF TRUCKS DERAILED, CAR UPRIGHT, NO HAZARDOUS INVOLVED AND NO INJURIES. 202488-d-07-18-07-SOO.Contributing Accident Cause: Defective spikes or missing spikes or other rail fasteners (use code T111 if results in wide gage)
202488-d-07-18-07-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN H51 WAS HEADING EAST TOWARDS DRAKE WITH 88 LD & 0 MTY'S ON WELDED RAIL. TRAIN WAS COASTING UPA SLIGHT INCLINE AT 22 MPH WHEN THE AIR DUMPED ON THE TRAIN. CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK TO INSPECT THE TRAIN. UPON REACHING THE 65TH CAR FOUND 7 CARS ON THEIR SIDE AND 1 MORE ON THE GROUND. INVESTIGATION DETERMINED PROBABLE CAUSE AS SUPER ELEVATION IMPROPER, EXCESSIVE FOR TRACK SPEED - THE RESULT OF OVERELEVATED TRACK, WITH DRY RAIL CONDITION AND NEGATIVE RAIL CANT DUE TO LIGHT 85# RAIL, SMALL SINGLESHOULDER TIE PLATES AND FASTENERS, AND THE PRESENCE OF HOLLOW WORN WHEEL TREAD PROFILES EXERTED LATERAL FORCES THAT CAUSED THE LOW RAIL TO ROLL OVER. WHILE THE 'OVER ELEVATION' FINDINGS AT THE POD WERE NOT URGENT DEFECTS, WHEN COUPLED WITH CONTRIBUTORY FACTORS THEY WERE SUFFICIENT TO CREATE A LATERAL FORCE CAUSING THE LOW RAIL TO ROLL OVER.

07000730-d-07-30-07-WW.Primary Accident Cause: Incapacitation due to injury or illness
07000730-d-07-30-07-WW.Accident Cause: Incapacitation due to injury or illness
07000730-d-07-30-07-WW.Narrative:
WHILE SHOVING A CUT OF 20 CARS BACK ONTO THE BACK LEG OF THE WYE FROM WHICH THEY WERE PULLED, FROM HIS POSITION AT THE REAR OF THE CUT, THE CONDUCTOR INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER OVER THE RADIO TO, "SHOVEBACK TO CLEAR".  THE ENGINEER PROCEEDED TO BACK-UP AT SLOW SPEED.  WHEN THE MOVEMENT REACHED THE POINT WHERE THE CONDUCTOR JUDGED THE MOVEMENT SHOULD HAVE STOPPED, HE CALLED THE ENGINEER ON THE RADIOAND TOLD HIM TO STOP.  HE REPEATED THIS SEVERAL TIMES, BUT GOT NO RESPONSE.

WHEN THE ENGINEER SUDDENLY REALIZED HE HAD PROCEEDED BEYOND WHERE HE SHOULD HAVE STOPPED, HE PUT THE TRAIN BRAKES INTO EMERGENCY AND STOPPED THE MOVEMENT.  AT THIS TIME IT WAS DECIDED THE REAR OF THE CUT HAD STOPPED SHORTOF THE CLERANCE POINT AND THE SWITCH, THE CONDUCTOR THEN PROCEEDED TO APPLY THE HANDBRAKES TO THE HEAD OF THE CUT (THERE WERE ALREADY HANDBRAKES APPLIED TO THE REAR END.) AND THEY WOULD PROCEED WITHTHEIR DUTIES.

UPON LATER INSPECION BY THE GENERAL CAR FOREMAN, IT WAS FOUND THE REAR CAR (MBLX 28610) HAD GONE PAST THE FOUL POINT AND SIDESWIPED A CAR (MBLX 27076) STANDING ON THE SWITCH OF THE CONVERGING BASE LEG TRACK OF THE WYE.  BOTH CARS WERE DAMAGED, BUT NOT DERAILED.

SUBSEQUENT INTERVIEW WITH THE ENGINEER REVEALED HE  HAS NO MEMORY OF THE SPAN OF TIME BETWEEN BEING TOLD TO SHOVE BACKTO CLEAR AND WHEN HE APPLIED THE BRAKES.  HE WAS TAKEN OUT OF SERVICE AND WAS TOLD HE WOULD NOT BEPERMITTED BACK IN COVERED SERVICE UNTIL CLEARED BY A PHYSICIAN.

CRLCS07023-d-07-05-07-CRL.Narrative: Crew was instructed by a CSX yard master that track 13 was clear in Bedford Park terminal. The yardmaster Did admit to me that this was this was a normal practice and that his turnover reflected thattrack 13 was clear and went on to show me paper work that stated so. The result of inaccurate information and the crew not protecting the shove resulted in one deraied car. It was stacked on top of the other car and the draw bar was snapped in the middle of the car. This was a empty intermodal car so it was two cars in one. this cut of cars they hit was 2900ft fortunatley no injurys occured. Estimated speed was 10-12 miles per hour. Csx yardmaster told me track speed in the yard was resticted speed not to exceed 15mph. No other damage occured to any except the knuckle and draw bar on the othercar that was impacted.Total Cost:  aproximately $10000 Car damage and  $800 dollars track damage
